data.title: Zagreb • Ski Holiday • Reviews • Skiing
data.meta_description: Find all information on the Ski Resort Sljeme - Zagreb with trail map, ticket prices, webcams, snow report and reviews.
data.text:
News

Host of the FIS Ski World Cup on January 04 & 05, 2023 (Ladies' Slalom)

The Ski Resort

Sljeme (Medvednica) ski resort is situated just a few miles outside of Zagreb, Croatia's capital city. The resort mainly accomodates visitors from the capital, but occasionally tourists find their way there too. The resort is located at the foot of Medvednica mountain. It is part of the homonymous nature park spanning over 228 square kilometres (around 22,800 ha).

There is only one black run (Crveni Spust), regularly used as a FIS World Cup venue. Moreover, there are two intermediate runs, Bijela Livada and Bijeli Spust as well as two intermediate runs, Zeleni Spust and Plavi Spust.

Advertisement

Interesting facts

Read more

The highest point of the track is 1,030 m above sea level.

Average snow depth during the season is 40 cm at summit elevation and 20 cm at base elevation. Snow coverage is usually best during January, offering an average snow depth of 40 cm at summit elevation and 20 cm at the base.

Sljeme - Zagreb features 3 sunny days on average per season. December is the sunniest month with an average of 2 sunny days.

On Mountain Dining

Sljeme is home to two dining and accomodation facilities. Hotel Tomislav dom is located at the resort's west, offering plain Croation dishes. Snjeszna kraljica offers tourist flats.

Must-Ski Runs

Don't miss the challenging FIS World Cup run Creveni Spust!

Travel Deals & Tips
